v2_vocabulary_qa.example: What HMDB ID corresponds to glucose?

v3_semantic_qa.example: What pathway does glucose participate in?

semantic_gap_assessment.v2_conclusion: KRAKEN is vocabulary-focused (v2 achieved 95.2% EM on entity resolution)

insights.finding: Search performs worse on semantic QA
insights.detail: Search EM drops from 95.2% (vocabulary) to 0.0% (semantic) - a 95.2pp decrease
insights.implication: Search is optimized for entity resolution, not semantic reasoning

insights.detail: Graph recall of 63.2% on semantic QA
insights.implication: KRAKEN has semantic relations accessible via /one-hop

insights.detail: Search excels at entity resolution; graph traversal for semantic reasoning
insights.implication: Hybrid approach recommended: search for entities, graph for relations

recommendations.rationale: Search is optimized for finding same entity across vocabularies
Graph traversal follows semantic edges directly
Use search to find entity, then graph to explore relations
